intro: Eutoca peraltae, commonly known as the Palaearctic bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to regions in Europe, North Africa, and parts of western Asia. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are bell-shaped, with blue to purple hues, and bloom during the summer months. Eutoca peraltae is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
